hanzi-su-wiki:
騒

Значения

Шуметь, тревожиться; шумный, беспокойный

Мнемоника

Лошадей 馬 беспокоят укусы блох 蚤 — насекомых 虫, вызывающих зуд 又.

Варианты

騷, 骚
purpleculture_pinyin:
sāo
Japanese variant of 骚
Японский вариант 骚
rtega_mnemonic:
騷騷RS
骚骚		騒harass, bother, annoy, disturb
  • fleas 蚤/𧈡 disturbing horses 馬
heisig_constituent: boisterous, team of horses, crotch, insect
Keyword_KANJIDIC: boisterous, make noise, clamor, disturb, excite
koohiiStory1: Or more precisely: the team of horses are getting boisterous because one of them got bitten in the crotch by a horse fly. The kanji also means to roar, make up noise, to kick up a fuss and to make merry. Perhaps it is exactly the etymology behind this kanji.
koohiiStory2: The hidden Greeks inside the Trojan Horse are getting boisterous as one of them is bitten in the crotch by a nasty insect. If they don´t shut up, the Trojans will hear them...
kunYomi: さわ.ぐ、うれい、さわ.がしい
jp_example_words:
騒動(そうどう): strife, riot, rebellion
騒がしい(さわがしい): noisy
騒ぎ(さわぎ): uproar, disturbance
騒音(そうおん): noise
騒々しい(そうぞうしい): noisy, boisterous
物騒(ぶっそう): dangerous, disturbed, insecure
騒ぐ(さわぐ): make a noise
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A horse gets trapped in a small room with a stool and an insect, and together they create a very boisterous situation. The horse and the insect are both scrambling frantically to get out of the small room, knocking the stool around all over the place.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine the boisterous sounds coming from this small room. Hear the horse neigh and stomp his hooves, hear the insect buzzing loudly, and hear the wooden stool rattle around as the horse and insect try to escape the room.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: At the height of their boisterous sounds, there's a sudden, awful CRONCH(!) and you see the soul (そう) of the insect slowly rising out of the room, through the ceiling.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The horse gets even more frightened now that it killed the insect and saw an actual soul float by its head and it grows even more boisterous.
Ru_Meaning: boisterous, make noise, clamor, disturb, excite
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the horse (馬) by the insect (虫) again (又) makes a noise

Shao
Name meaning

sāo
яп. вм. 骚
Radicals: 馬, 又, 虫  (horse, stool, insect)
Meaning Mnemonic
A horse gets trapped in a small room with a stool and an insect, and together they create a very boisterous situation. The horse and the insect are both scrambling frantically to get out of the small room, knocking the stool around all over the place.
Imagine the boisterous sounds coming from this small room. Hear the horse neigh and stomp his hooves, hear the insect buzzing loudly, and hear the wooden stool rattle around as the horse and insect try to escape the room.
Reading Mnemonic
At the height of their boisterous sounds, there's a sudden, awful CRONCH(!) and you see the soul (そう) of the insect slowly rising out of the room, through the ceiling.
The horse gets even more frightened now that it killed the insect and saw an actual soul float by its head and it grows even more boisterous.
